card.desc: Collecting and aggregating energy consumption data in the home and publishing it to a P2P network to influence consumer behavior and enable industry data subscription

content.body:
Otak is a smart home device that consumers can place in their home that connects their household devices through IoT (or IoT attachments as necessary). Otak collects and aggregates energy usage data in the home and publish it to a P2P network using Nomad. Otak will have three service capabilities to consumers: 1) Capture energy usage drivers: The data collected will be shared with the consumer in real time via a dashboard to help them better understand the drivers of their energy usage, and give insights and recommendations on how to reduce their usage (ie, your refrigerator uses 17% more energy than the avg refrigerator in your zip code). This will assist consumers save money by lowering their energy bill and reduce their environmental footprint. 2) Advisory services: Otak will have the ability to monitor energy patterns across devices to give consumers advanced notice of appliance failures. 3) Smart Home services: Provide the ability to control the appliances, allowing on/off, start/stop, schedule and remote access functionality In addition to consumer offerings, Otak will also have an industry offering to companies interested in energy usage data. Early target industries will be energy, insurance, banking, retail and home improvement. For example, Home Depot would be interested in targeted advertisements to consumers with under-performing / inefficient appliances. This could be shared with companies via a subscription service using the hash key to the Nomad for real time data users and a packaged data files for periodic data users.

How it works: The OTAK device collects power usage data from different devices around the Home and collects the data in a JSON format and packages it in real time. It then uses the Distributed peer to peer Network and Nomad to Publish the JSON file out to the world. Subscribers who are given the appropriate Hash Channel can then receive a specific OTAK Device’s JSON Files. The interval of file send and reception is approximately every 30 seconds depending on the peer population of the Network.
content.calloutBody: How might we gather the unique energy cycles of individual appliances and publish them for public use
content.why: Otak allows visibility into consumers data usage at a level of granularity that provides actionable insights, both for consumers as well as industry. Expect overall efficiencies at an individual and societal level.

-KhTpp0quOFt24Xzbypc.desc: Collecting and aggregating energy consumption data in the home and publishing it to a P2P network to influence consumer behavior and enable industry data subscription
-KhTpp0quOFt24Xzbypc.subtitle: Creating a marketplace for living data streams of device-level consumption data.
-KhTpp0quOFt24Xzbypc.title: Otak

card.desc: Let's Move! is a Facebook Messenger bot that integrates with Yelp to provide geo-located recommendations (best and next best ratings) for moving companies.

content.body:
Moving is a hassle, involving many tasks that can be automated. As a smart bot in Facebook Messenger, Let's Move! integrates with Yelp to provide geo-located recommendations (best and next best ratings) for moving companies. Once the bot has assisted during a move, it can be used again for other life events—another move, planning for children, etc.—or as a personal assistant to help in everyday tasks like scheduling a party or a get together. The bot might event take care of even more mundane tasks like wishing people happy birthday on facebook.

Imagine that bots move beyond singular tasks to learn about you and represent you over time. As the bot needs personal information, it asks for your permission and stores that information. Once you trust the moving bot enough to give it your personal information, it can use that as an asset to streamline your interaction with other organizations, whether those interactions are with humans or other bots. In a world where most of our services are delivered via bot interactions, this “butlerbot” can work for you, coordinating across organizations to give you the products and services you need.
content.calloutBody: How might we create a consumer-side bot that interfaces with multiple business bots on our behalf?
content.why: This was an investigation of AI and emerging UX of bots. Going forward, we expect bots will interact with bots, especially on behalf of people or institutions. This prototype investigates some of the user experience elements of this emerging space.

-KhTpqlPHWkFsREUkRw8.desc: Let's Move! is a Facebook Messenger bot that integrates with Yelp to provide geo-located recommendations (best and next best ratings) for moving companies.
-KhTpqlPHWkFsREUkRw8.subtitle: A smart bot that automates much of the moving process.
-KhTpqlPHWkFsREUkRw8.title: Let's Move!

card.desc: See a comprehensive view of your patients' most critical prescription history right in your hand.

content.body:
We are facing an exploding opioid abuse epidemic in the US. One piece of this multi-layered issue is the seeking of excessive opioid prescriptions from medical providers. How can providers make more informed decisions prior to prescribing opioids? RxLucent puts a patient's critical prescription history right in the provider's hand at the point of decision.

RxLucent streamlines the doctor's process within their familiar EHR experience to go from history, through diagnosis, to treatment, without the need to access additional systems. Pulling from the universal blockchain prescription record, doctors no longer have to worry about missing information or having to contact other providers for records. This will create a streamlined process for practitioners to improve compliance and mitigate the burnout caused by rising administrative burdens of having to enter repetitive data in multiple systems.

Understanding the pressures on a doctor’s time, RxLucent walks the provider through the prescription process, providing the critical information at each decision point. Providers have ultimate flexibility in choosing their most efficient interaction--web, mobile, text, voice-activated chat--to provide for access, privacy, and speed.

Behind the scenes, the universal blockchain prescription record is industry-changing. Not only does it provide for better patient and provider experiences, it also allows for platform-agnostic data access and integration for EHR providers, e-prescription services, government agencies, researchers, insurance companies, pharmaceutical companies, and others.
content.calloutBody: How might we ensure that patients aren't getting overlapping/extra prescriptions?
insights: From the Wellbeing industry perspective, Virgin Pulse is interested in integrations with EHR's to improve and consolidate the member experience. Blockchain technology may be an effective intermediary for this integration if it is adopted widely by the EHR industry.

If this product achieved large-scale adoption, Athena would want to integrate with this service so that they could provide a more streamlined experience for their providers as well as a better patient experience. Athena would not be a first-adopter, but would certainly want to integrate with it once established.

Blue Cross Blue Shield could use a prescription blockchain to expedite prior authorization process through smart contracts, monitor prescribing patterns of providers and establish care management (behavioral health and substance abuse therapy) protocols for members showing narcotic seeking tendencies.
content.why: This product will benefit patients, doctors, and society at large. By leveraging an EHR-agnostic blockchain, potentially accessed through Nomad, critical patient prescription data can be shared across all medical professionals. This will improve patient care by providing doctors with comprehensive patient data. It will also streamline the physician workflow by facilitating interoperability with prescription databases and bringing the prescription experience into the main patient care workflow. It will also provide essential patient information to physicians at the point of service to aid improved decision making prior to dispensing opioid prescriptions.

-KhTpsrRS1rA3fR75l5U.desc: See a comprehensive view of your patients' most critical prescription history right in your hand.
-KhTpsrRS1rA3fR75l5U.subtitle: Blockchain prescriptions as an asset
-KhTpsrRS1rA3fR75l5U.title: RxLucent

card.desc: Cumulus AI is a utility grade framework to connect disaggregated data and distribute insights for the IoT.

content.body:
Cumulus AI is a utility grade framework to connect disaggregated data and distribute insights for the IoT. The Cumulus API facilitates the collection of energy data through standardization of communication and engagement protocols for IoT devices and appliances in the home. Artificial intelligence informs decision making across an ecosystem of data services that coordinate consumption devices, generation equipment, and 3rd party providers.

Below is the use-case we prototoyped:
A homeowner with distributed generation capability and capacity to store energy with power walls or electric vehicles can be an active participant within the energy market. Cumulus AI compares a home’s energy usage, storage and production capacity with market conditions, weather forecasts, personal event calendars, and other data to automate energy storage and discharge into the grid to maximize profits and efficiency.
content.calloutBody: How might we utilize data to make intelligent decisions for IoT devices
insights: Improves grid reliability by giving utilities more options to manage peaks.
Provides new opportunities for utilities to lower cost by purchasing low cost power from residential sources.
Residential Customers need financial incentive to participate in new energy market by leveraging energy investments in home.
Promoting new renewable generation and storage technology to will lower electric cost to customers
content.why: Effective coordination and management of distributed fleet energy, creating a financial incentive model for the utility and customers to participate in a new energy market.

-KhY-mxAuyz1Iz7gr1PI.desc: Cumulus AI is a utility grade framework to connect disaggregated data and distribute insights for the IoT.
-KhY-mxAuyz1Iz7gr1PI.subtitle: An AI that intelligently sells your smart home's excess energy back to the grid
-KhY-mxAuyz1Iz7gr1PI.title: Cumulus AI

card.desc: An energy marketplace that enables EV drivers to establish a user profile with preferences account for driving lifestyle needs and values (time, money, environment), and allows them to turn their excess battery capacity into immediate, tangible benefits.

content.body:
Jules is a professional working women who travels often for work.  She often finds herself driving her electric vehicle to the airport, where she parks in designated EV charging spaces in the parking deck.  She's often gone for 2-3 days at a time, and her car is often time sitting there with a fully charged battery.  Wouldn't it be great if there was a way for Jules to gain benefit by giving energy from her battery while she is away...as long as the battery is full or as has enough capacity to get her where she needs to go when she returns?  From this problem, the Jules Energy Exchange prototype was born!  

Using proto.io, a UI was developed where battery capacity takers could provide relevant offers to battery capacitor takers such as Jules.  Within the app, Jules would provide profile information, and the app would leverage data inputs such as battery state, weather, destination, google calendar information to match her to relevant offers provided by users such as utilities, municipalities, commercial & industrial users.  The platform would leverage data such as real time peak demand pricing, building energy management data, capacity needs, etc to present offers for ev owners.    

When matches are made, transactions are captured in the Blockchain and EV owners receive Jule Coins for giving their energy.
content.calloutBody: How might we enable electric vehicle owners to turn their batteries into assets for the grid?
content.why: This protoype is interesting as the EV market continues to grow and the battery capacity for vehicles continues to increase.  A statistics that hits home is that 18,000 equals 180MW of energy load and 180MW of load is enough to power 45,000 homes.  As of 2016, there are 25,000 EVs on the road in Georgia and 220,000 on the road in California!

-KhY6FBTG-ZEB-czgsft.desc: An energy marketplace that enables EV drivers to establish a user profile with preferences account for driving lifestyle needs and values (time, money, environment), and allows them to turn their excess battery capacity into immediate, tangible benefits.
-KhY6FBTG-ZEB-czgsft.subtitle: A marketplace for selling excess energy in EVs
-KhY6FBTG-ZEB-czgsft.title: Jules

card.desc: Myko is a mesh network between smart objects that collect data and relay messages to one another. Myko facilitates relationships between businesses and consumers by creating data relationships between businesses themselves.

content.body:
Myko is a digital fungal network that connects objects. Using nomad as a platform, myko enabled devices can speak to each other across composite nodes. In Myko's initial prototype, we explored connecting businesses currently have no way of having deeply rooted economic relationships.

The usecase in this prototype highlights a relationship between a business and a coffee shop that currently have no way of interacting with each other. The two parties have the base factors in place for a symbiotic relationship: the coffee shop needs regular customers to survive, and the business needs to provide it's employees with fresh coffee and keep them in a healthy state of mind for working. In the prototype, two plinths with weight sensors act as atomic nodes streaming the sensor data over IPFS. Myko itself is a composite nomad node, a piece of software that consumes atomic node streams. The composite Myko node recieves data in realtime, and does logic process to determine how many cups of coffee have been poured, if there is a fresh pot of coffee now, or if the coffee on the plinth is old. When placing the plinths in both the business and the coffee shop, a relationship is created such that when the coffee shop has fresh coffee and the business' coffee is old, employees are sent over to the coffee shop for coffee and a walk outside. This way, the coffee shop recieves regular customers. The business model in this prototype can go even further to create a stable flow of income for the coffee shop by creating a central fund for the business' employees to pull money from when buying coffee from the shop. This fund would be paid for monthly by the business, creating income flow for the coffee shop.

A second Myko object is a button that sends out timestamped offers to all peers that subscribe to it. The usecase in the prototype is a small bakery that bakes fresh bread at certain time intervals, and wants to create demand around the freshness and scarcity of the goods as they degrade in quality. The button prototype manifests itself in another composite node which has a purchase button on it. When the button is tapped, a "Hot buns" notification is sent out across the network, and starts a timer tracking how long the buns have been out of the oven. The node displays a price that dynamically changes as time goes on; when buying hot buns, the price is higher, when buying cold buns the price is lower.

Both of these concepts excite us about the opportunities they represent from a machine automation standpoint. What would happen if we instrumented factory machines with stress sensors that empowered them to automatically purchase replacement parts for themselves so they continue to run at optimum efficiency? If the machines are connected and communicating with eachother in realtime, can they coordinate a group buy of parts to get a discount?

Next steps with these prototypes are to pilot them in different usecases to test scalability and feasibility of nomad nodes that instrument environments.
content.calloutBody: how might we facilitate grounded connections between real-world businesses that allow them to share resources?
insights: If businesses share proprietary data, there has to be a tradeoff for them to trust their neighbors. Creating economic microrelationships can start the process of building trust in a world of competition.
content.why: Businesses are siloed into proprietary data sets by nature. Opening streams between businesses for digital collaboration creates an environment where businesses act as a communal unit. At a macro level, open data systems for businesses create an economy where decentralized systems and cryptocurrency can be more readily adopted, resulting in more private, personal, and efficient experience for consumers.

card.desc: A blockchain-driven decentralized Carfax

content.body:
This prototype creates a decentralized vehicle history report. Currently, information logged in a vehicle history report relies on self-reporting from mechanics and is therefore often incomplete. Each request for a report from companies such as Carfax costs $40; as a result, users only view the report when buying a used car and not for the continuous monitoring of a car’s performance. 
 
In this prototype, we attach a RFID sensor to an airbag. We simulate the scenario when the airbag needs to be replaced. The RFID sensor throws an error when the wrong part is installed; and when the correct part is installed, the event is logged onto the blockchain using Tierion.
content.desc: A blockchain-driven decentralized Carfax
features: The prototype vehicle detects and repairs its own parts. Using IoT concepts the vehicle is a logical cluster of sensors that log a its history. This history of parts failure is logged to a blockchain, creating a secure audit trail that cannot be tampered with. Since all issues are on the blockchain, a vehicle history is available that is decentralized and immutable. This removes the reliance on 3rd parties for verification and trust. Because the car failures are decentralized and public, services can be built on this information such as a marketplace between car owners needing service and service providers bidding on work. A Yelp type service can also be built on top of the service history data analyzing time between part failure, when service is begun, and when service is completed.
insights: The blockchain-driven marketplace allows service shops to place bids on contracts. From the perspective of consumer or enterprise car owners, vehicle history reports will be able to be managed in concert. Service shops, on the other hand, will be able to gain new customers by tracking transactions on the blockchain then bid on contracts.
Here are some learnings and process flows https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B6BL7IzhWrP0eDY5Ty1LZHg2LTg?usp=sharing
content.next: The prototype vehicle detects and repairs its own parts. Using IoT concepts the vehicle is a logical cluster of sensors that log a its history. This history of parts failure is logged to a blockchain, creating a secure audit trail that cannot be tampered with. Since all issues are on the blockchain, a vehicle history is available that is decentralized and immutable. This removes the reliance on 3rd parties for verification and trust. Because the car failures are decentralized and public, services can be built on this information such as a marketplace between car owners needing service and service providers bidding on work. A Yelp type service can also be built on top of the service history data analyzing time between part failure, when service is begun, and when service is completed.
content.why: Car owners should be able to track and monitor the performance and repair history of their vehicle. The information should be transparent. There aren’t any existing systems that thoroughly capture the entire history of a car; when one switches mechanics, the history is not transferred from one to another. Once a car owns and maintains its own record, users will be able to perform better valuation in the second-hand market.

-KoShs78k7vYZBi9vO2s.subtitle: A blockchain-driven decentralized Carfax

Data can be separate, or overlaid to highlight anomalies. Data can be viewed, moved, enlarged, overlaid, as needed. Graphics could be customized to support any kind of data aggregation format as needed.

card.desc: ReCoin is a renewable energy credit that is mined by driving an electric vehicle on "clean" energy.

content.body:
We built a simple Web app which communicates with the Automatic API and Ethereum Web3 JS node in the front end with a Vue JS framework. The browser gets real time events through web socket which trigger a token smart contract write functions to issue tokens to the input address. The goal was to prototype the mining process and issuance of tokens although it remains a rather centralized process. Ideally we would implement a mining function for E.V.s to mine tokens by solving mathematics formulas proving they actually drove the amount of miles required to mint tokens.

We also prototyped the charging and mining process using an arduino and node.js web app. It shows how to create certified zero-emission miles in the form of recoins, a user's vehicle would purchase SREC off the market as it charges. This would ensure that it is driving on clean energy and that every recoin produced, no matter the vehicle, is 1 zero-emission mile. 

The importance of standardization around the zero-emission mile is important so that the token can more easily be integrated into existing markets and sustainability initiatives. We feel that this gives the asset more value and business'/consumers who decide to purchase these tokens know exactly what they are getting.
content.desc: ReCoin is a renewable energy credit that is mined by driving an electric vehicle on "clean" energy.
features: The recoin market depends on the use of blockchain. Adding the SREC purchasing to the equation introduces another opportunity to use the blockchain smart contract capabilities. For example, if SRECs were awarded through the blockchain, an EV vehicle could participate in a smart contract that only allows it to generate recoins if the energy in the car was backed by a REC certificate for "green" energy. In addition, we invision the cars actually mining the recoins as they drive. This means creating an algorithm that they can calculate as they drive each mile and mint a recoin.
insights: Standardizing the recoin to represent 1 zero-emission mile means that we must use SRECs at the time of charging to ensure "clean" power to the vehicle. This incentives people to drive electric vehicles as well as driving on "green" energy. This creates another mechanism for distributing SRECs and it helps increase the value of SRECs.
content.next: The recoin market depends on the use of blockchain. Adding the SREC purchasing to the equation introduces another opportunity to use the blockchain smart contract capabilities. For example, if SRECs were awarded through the blockchain, an EV vehicle could participate in a smart contract that only allows it to generate recoins if the energy in the car was backed by a REC certificate for "green" energy. In addition, we invision the cars actually mining the recoins as they drive. This means creating an algorithm that they can calculate as they drive each mile and mint a recoin.
content.why: By standardizing the recoin to represent a zero-emission mile, our token, that is mined by driving electric vehicles on "clean" energy (e.g. solar power, SREC, wind), can be traded and sold as an asset with an understanding of what it represents. Business' with sustainability initiatives can offset their emissions from driving vehicles with recoins "clean" miles.

content.body: We create a twin blockchain system to track and certify all individual components of the airbag unit. When parts are manufactured by a certified manufacturer, the part is placed on a closed blockchain (PartChain) controlled by automaker. When a part is attempted to be installed in a vehicle, the vehicle runs a check on PartChain to establish its existence. If it is verified,  ownership is transferred to that vehicle on a public blockchain, CarChain. If not, relevant authorities (e.g. auto maker, driver, insurer) are notified. This twin system also allows us to issue precise recalls to vehicles with malfunctioning parts. Doing so might allow us to keep tabs on quality of the devices (avoiding massive recalls), dissolve the counterfeit and stolen unit market, and bring new levels of trust and security to this vital safety device.
content.desc: For e.g., track airbag with vehicle to ensure only genuine manufacturer approved parts are present
features: Blockchain could be useful in terms of tracking a variety of different components from different manufacturers operating in different geographic locations. It could also pair to a record for the vehicle so that the owner and those working on the machine can have insights into specifically what is installed in the vehicle. The record of that device can be used to guarantee security and authenticity. IoT sensors would be used for tagging purposes. Perhaps automation could come into play in terms of generating records for the component parts, but also for ordering maintenance when something is wrong with the airbag, without the need for the human to intervene and take action (example: what if a small set of cars have faulty airbags that need to be recalled? The vehicle could know it has one of the issue units and automatically arrange for service without the driver needing to be involved).

The use of a private blockchain (PartChain) with certified manufacturers and automakers creates a closed ecosystem for trust to be established. Potentially, this could scale to an industry-level solution although we still need to push on the feasibility of such a solution.

The use of a public blockchain to establish vehicle-part ownership is relevant since there are many different parties who might want to access this shared truth. From car owners to insurers to regulators, this creates a gold standard of truth.
insights: Proposed solution is Automotive industry specific and would also effect Insurance industry
content.next:
Blockchain could be useful in terms of tracking a variety of different components from different manufacturers operating in different geographic locations. Perhaps automation could come into play in terms of generating records for the component parts, but also for ordering maintenance when something is wrong with the airbag, without the need for the human to intervene and take action (example: what if a small set of cars have faulty airbags that need to be recalled? The vehicle could know it has one of the issue units and automatically arrange for service without the driver needing to be involved).

The use of a private blockchain (PartChain) with certified manufacturers and automakers creates a closed ecosystem for trust to be established. Potentially, this could scale to an industry-level solution although we still need to push on the feasibility of such a solution. 

The use of a public blockchain to establish vehicle-part ownership is relevant since there are many different parties who might want to access this shared truth. From car owners to insurers to regulators, this creates a gold standard of truth.
content.why: Reduce counterfeit parts and increase safety in Automotive transportation

card.desc: SmartBin is a platform for sensor and crowdsourced neighborhood cleanliness data to optimize trash pickup and foster overall cleanliness in an area.

content.body:
With the paired SmartCity + SmartBin system, city officials and residents can monitor neighborhoods' cleanliness status in real time, encouraging shared communication, transparency, and efficient resolution (including by proactive residents). The city can have data-driven waste removal services, only routing to and stopping for full SmartBins, thus reducing gas usage and personnel hours. Block- and city-level data dashboards of recycling and trash totals over time can be used to anticipate future disposal needs and motivate neighborhood waste reduction efforts. The SmartBins themselves - secured and sealed with rotating drawers - will reduce issues around odor, flies, and rats, and free up space behind buildings for resident use.

This prototype uses the Particle Photon (an IoT device) to connect the sensor-equipped SmartBin to the intermediary cloud, data which is accessible to resident and city official users of the platform.
content.calloutBody: How might a Digital Twin of a city block become a platform to engage neighbors in city and sensor data?
content.why: This system - which logs and analyzes 311 calls and resident reports - could be useful for the insurance industry by providing a more in-depth profile of a given area (in terms of relevance to health risks, property values, etc.)

card.desc: Greenr uses streaming variable data to create a peer-to-peer Solar REC market with trust at its core.

content.body:
Renewable Energy Credits allow solar panel owners to profit from their solar panels and encourage polluters to subsidize clean energy. However, a lack of trust between buyer and seller makes it difficult for individual homeowners to join the market. Our complicated, slow, and tedious verification process discourages them from selling RECs. Homeowners miss out on money, and buyers have fewer local RECs to choose from.

Greenr fixes this process by creating instant trust between homeowners and REC buyers. Using streaming variable data, like real-time weather and neighborhood trends, Greenr verifies the truth of a solar panel’s output. Nomad allows this process to be decentralized, making setup simple and eliminating the need for a central authority. New RECs are minted instantly and posted to a peer-to-peer marketplace, meaning homeowners never have to wait to profit from their clean energy.

Establishing trust early opens the REC marketplace to people who would be otherwise excluded from today’s complex systems. Small transactions between homeowners and small buyers are simple and trustworthy, creating a network of individuals that support the creation of clean energy.
content.calloutBody: How might we "know" that the information generated by IoT devices is trustworthy enough to transact on?
content.desc: Greenr uses streaming variable data to create a peer-to-peer Solar REC market with trust at its core.
insights: A trusted peer-to-peer market for RECs would incentivize more people to install solar panels or offset their carbon footprint.

card.desc: A blockchain-based network that tracks personal automobile usage pattern and leverages data from a network of similar vehicles to provide predictive maintenance.

content.body:
The front-end of Fonzie is a mobile app for the personal car user. The app helps the user track car usage pattern—brake, acceleration, gas consumption, etc—to build a health history of the vehicle. The back-end links each individual user to a network of comparable vehicles. Leveraging data tracked from the fleet, Fonzie uses machine learning to predict future usage and maintenance patterns and provide maintenance recommendations for the car user. This preemptive measure alleviates the stress of potential breakdown and allows the car user to plan ahead. 
 
To illustrate this point, we created a demo using MarioKart. Linking the the gas pedal to an Arduino button, we track the amount of acceleration time. Players can opt to play in AI/Auto-refill mode or Manual-refill mode. Auto-refill mode automatically refills the gas tank when it drops below 20%. Manual-refill allows the player to play until the gas tank drops to 0%, after which the player is forced to suspend play for 10 seconds to simulate the amount of time lost from car maintenance. This demo allows players to experience the time versus cost tradeoff in car maintenance.
content.desc: A blockchain-based network that tracks personal automobile usage pattern and leverages data from a network of similar vehicles to provide predictive maintenance.
features: The system takes advantage of blockchain to ensure maximum confidentiality of the drivers data. Those interviewed all shared the primary concern of data security and would prefer to opt out of the shared data network over risking exposure of their information. By using blockchain for all data storage, we are able to provide the extra layer of security required for individuals to participate in the network. Maximum participation across the network will enable the AI engine to make better recommendations, lower all drivers maintenance costs, and reduce the number of catastrophic failures.
insights: Any industry with equipment would be able to leverage the engine to capture sensor data and incorporate that into machine learning and AI. The ability to profile based on type of repair, auto-ordering parts, and auto-scheduling maintenance will streamline the repair process, further reducing the amount of wear on each machine and prolonging its life. The predictive ability of the engine will also enable companies to schedule maintenance around planned downtime, knowing in advance what items to order and have on hand during the repair window.
content.next: The system takes advantage of blockchain to ensure maximum confidentiality of the drivers data. Those interviewed all shared the primary concern of data security and would prefer to opt out of the shared data network over risking exposure of their information. By using blockchain for all data storage, we are able to provide the extra layer of security required for individuals to participate in the network. Maximum participation across the network will enable the AI engine to make better recommendations, lower all drivers maintenance costs, and reduce the number of catastrophic failures.
content.why: The status quo of car maintenance records rely on self-reporting—records aren’t always accurate or thorough. Aside from yearly check-ups, there are few markers that tells the car owner when and what needs to be fixed to ensure continued good performance. As a result, maintenance of cars often occur after something breaks. These types of failures cost the car owner a lot of time and stress. We suggest that a better model would be to use a network of sensors and a health history of a network of vehicles of the same make and model to predict when a maintenance needs to be performed, such that it can happen ahead of any catastrophic failure.

-Kox4g7BEnur9j4WSgiL.desc: A blockchain-based network that tracks personal automobile usage pattern and leverages data from a network of similar vehicles to provide predictive maintenance.
-Kox4g7BEnur9j4WSgiL.subtitle: Tracking personal automobile usage to provide predictive maintenance.

card.desc: Portfolio investing in crypto currencies powered by wisdom of the crowd

content.body: We 1. tried to launch a real life crypto currency token fund token (TFT) available for purchase at our science fair table (almost there!) 2. created a prototype that captures the portfolio rebalancing experience of the crowd voting. We created these two prototypes because 1. we want to deepen our understanding of blockchain technology by actually launching a TFT 2. we want to experiment with combining machine learning algorithms with wisdom of the crowd model in fund management
content.desc: Portfolio investing in crypto currencies powered by wisdom of the crowd
features: We enable TFT holders to own the underlying digital assets - something that is not possible in real life. This leads to a radical transparency. Imagine no more repeats of the 2008 financial crisis when many people invested in seemingly secure funds that specialized in collaterized debt (but ultimately crashed because they were based on shifty subprime mortgages).
insights: An algorithm + wisdom of the crowd model could pose a serious competitive challenge to traditional methods of investing that involves a fund manager and hefty management fees.
content.why: 1. This space is so new with only a handful of companies attempting a TFT right now. There is a huge opportunity for us to introduce an alternative standard/ governance protocol once we better understand this space 2. Most portfolio investment vehicles in real life either rely on robo-advisors or human fund managers - few mix algorithms with wisdom of the crowd method to maximize returns while keeping fees low

card.desc: Recoin is a renewable energy credit system that is used to promote sustainable travel habits. Electric vehicle drivers “mint” recoins and social consumers purchase recoins to offset their CO2 emissions.

content.body:
In order to incentivize societally beneficial actions, we created a decentralized market place called Recoin. It is a renewable energy credit system that incentivizes drivers of electric vehicles by providing social consumers an opportunity to purchase recoins as a means of offsetting carbon emissions. 
In order for recoin to succeed there must be a supply and demand of recoins. We identified two key stakeholders in this process: the electric vehicle (EV) drivers and the buyers of recoins, labeled as “the social consumers”. Through user interviews we identified two key insights. For the EV drivers, the recoin process must be completely automated for greater adoption. For adoption among the social consumers, small but frequent opportunities to offset carbon emissions are more effective. 
The process is initiated when a EV driver pairs their car to the recoin system. A tracking system will automatically generate a recoin for each mile that is driven by the EV. The recoin is associated with a blockchain ID and placed onto the marketplace. As the recoins are purchased from the marketplace, the EV driver will be passively accruing money. The EV driver has two options, they can simply watch their electric miles turn into money, or they can choose to donate a % of their earnings to the charity of their choice. The information and options associated with these decisions are found on the “marketplace” and “recoins for good” section of the recoin app. 
For the non-EV driver, we prototyped how the recoin system could be integrated into their daily lives through their Uber usage (this behavior can extend to other examples such as amazon purchases and lyft rides). By opting into recoin, a social consumer is prompted to offset the CO2 emissions from their most recent Uber ride through a phone notification that pops up immediately after completing an Uber ride. This would be a micro-transaction that would only add cents to the total price of the Uber trip. From user interviews we identified that micro-transactions that are viewed as socially impactful will drive adoption. The more Uber miles that are offset by recoin, will make the value of recoins rise. As a result, there is more incentive to drive an electric vehicle and be a “miner” of recoins.
features: Prototyping a user interface for exchange of crypto tokens on blockchain. A decentralized ledger allows the trade of these tokens without trusted third party where users can buy and verify origin of the tokens. (Making sure they are EV miles etc.) Blockchain allows also the mining of many decimals of miles such as making 0.000002341 tokens on a short ride and combining with other token miners to make greater impact.
insights: The dynamic of the potential solution hits across all various industry spectrums that hold importance on social and environmental well-being.  From a health perspective, there are primary effects of the solution as it can pertain to physical, emotional, and mental well-being.  The prototype also largely touches energy and carbon output while giving incentives for those to use electric means for transportation and those who do not to offset their “part”.   We envision it would be easy for businesses across all industries to get involved as it promotes not only awareness, but good faith in the eyes of both their employees and the general public.
content.next: Prototyping a user interface for exchange of crypto tokens on blockchain. A decentralized ledger allows the trade of these tokens without trusted third party where users can buy and verify origin of the tokens. (Making sure they are EV miles etc.) Blockchain allows also the mining of many decimals of miles such as making 0.000002341 tokens on a short ride and combining with other token miners to make greater impact.
content.why: Similar to how solar and wind recs promote the usage of renewable energy sources, Recoin leverages the use of electric vehicles to be financially rewarded for a societal  beneficial behavior. Through micro transactions around daily behaviors, like riding Uber or Amazon purchases, we hypothesize that we can create a sustainable demand of Recoins. This would in turn promote more electric vehicle drivers by creating a financial incentive to using EV over traditional vehicles.

-KoypNkZB3M67_6tCVjK.subtitle: A renewable energy credit system used to promote sustainable travel habits.

card.desc: An AR system that organizes information spatially for doctors and nurses, presenting it contextually when needed to make their decision making more efficient.

content.body: Using Aurasma, we created a potential patient situation where a nurse has “tagged” data points for that patient representing pertinent information for a Dr. to review in order to provide an assessment. The idea is that this initial interaction would be honed around initial/current vitals, and relevant test that provide “abnormal” or predictive/supporting data for the doctor. Additionally, historical data would be available for the Dr to see as applicable. Both nurses and doctors would be able to order tests and medications as needed, and as allowed by their role or licensing.
content.desc: An AR system that organizes information spatially for doctors and nurses, presenting it contextually when needed to make their decision making more efficient.
features: Our prototype uses Aurasma to display display information when it detects the right context. In the scenario we prototyped, we set triggers on things where a doctor might want the  information overlayed in the AR display. These objects included:
Patients
ECR Machines
Patient reports
insights: AR could assist financial companies sort information and allow users to look at/process information, and reach out for research information that is relevant. Health care companies could allow customers(in a health emergency) a way to see which healthcare provider is closest to them, and which one would be most effective for their ailment. Or AR could visualize data in choosing a healthcare provider, revealing details about the Dr. and whether or not they are accpting patients, where they are located in relation to the customer. AR could also be used to deliver testing results. And provide them with a richer understanding of the impacts of that information.

Our prototype uses Aurasma to display display information when it detects the right context. In the scenario we prototyped, we set triggers on things where a doctor might want the  information overlayed in the AR display. These objects included:

card.desc: Artificial Intelligence for Natural Hires

content.body:
Tobi is a suite of hiring tools that assists recruiters in getting from 1000 applications to 20. We begin with a chatbot that converses with applicants as a more intimate pre-interview screen. For example, we built-in a soccer game scenario that pulls out an applicant's "score" for teamwork to individual contribution. 

Tobi would then use Natural Language Processing to analyze this initial conversation, defining how the candidate meets specific traits and sentiments set by the recruiter. It outputs a uniform data type that was then put into our machine learning algorithm. 

As a test, we trained the system to predict good candidates for IDEO CoLab Makeathons based on a dataset of 750 previous applicants. We strived to define a "truth" that the machine should learn against. Although this is an open question, we used recruiter approvals and denials in addition to current employees' TobiScores to define this truth. 

Going off on an insight that humans and machines should work together to make final decisions, we show the output of the machine learning in a user interface containing a skill web of a candidate's weighted traits. The interface also displays insights from the chatbot conversation, basic resume information, profile, and warnings based on unmet job criteria.
content.desc: Artificial Intelligence for Natural Hires
features: Artificial Intelligence can clearly automate processes but also has the danger of codifying human bias. It is also able to detect patterns that hiring managers may not even consider. Working alongside a human allows us to correct these biased patterns in both ourselves and in Tobi.
insights: Every company hires! We're not all rockstars at hiring, so how can we ask machines to help us in being fair, unbiased, and efficient.
content.next: Artificial Intelligence can clearly automate processes but also has the danger of codifying human bias. It is also able to detect patterns that hiring managers may not even consider. Working alongside a human allows us to correct these biased patterns in both ourselves and in Tobi.
content.why: Tobi not only saves time on the early, tedious stages of hiring (automation) but also assists in finding star candidates. It also makes the hiring process more data driven, transparent, and therefore equitable. The early stages are currently not intimate and inefficient and we aim to help hiring managers pull relevant conversation points earlier on.

-Koystlt02XeqHSANNsh.subtitle: Artificial Intelligence for Natural Hires
team: Anand Upender, Takashi Wickes, Kenny Okagaki, Constantine Pitsilos
-Koystlt02XeqHSANNsh.title: Tobi

card.desc: Credable is a decentralized peer-to-peer platform to help individuals build "credit" via sharing, transferring, and borrowing of various assets.

content.body: Credable is a decentralized P2P sharing (using AirBnB, Uber, Turo, etc. data), transferring (using Venmo, ApplePay, Square, etc. data), borrowing (using Kiva, Upstart, Prosper, etc. data) platform. The user allows access to financial transaction data from bank and credit card statements (as a start - this is the minimum viable data required to enable the platform to function). In future iterations we will research how we may extract data (potentially via mutually beneficial partnerships). The user's transactions helps their overall Credable rating - because it shows they are honoring their various agreements. The application shows where the user is relative to a specific goal(s) they input into the platform, and this generates an overall % of where they are relative to achieving these goal(s). Transparency between users is not an option, it is an integral component of the platform. Credable encourages transparency in upward momentum towards achieving users' goals.
content.desc: Credable is a decentralized peer-to-peer platform to help individuals build "credit" via sharing, transferring, and borrowing of various assets.

card.desc: Real-time and 10 year static cryptocurrency market simulation

content.body:
For this Sprint we wanted to dig deeper into how we might make recoins valuable and potentially seen as an investment/tangible asset.  We assessed a potential solution around creating a test market that would illustrate the value of recoins on a few different levels.  Multiple variables contributed to how the value could fluctuate based on market dynamics via a basic supply and demand economic scale.  In order to create a market, we needed to start with some baselines that were estimated based on extensive data gathering, but before any of this could happen, validation on user assumptions at a larger scale (that we made on our first Sprint) needed to occur.  We did this via a survey in which we had over 200 respondents using various channels.  This survey gauged users' brand and other preferences, frequency of use, emotion, price points, emotional components and more specific questioning related to pollution and options around our solution.    
A lot of our market tests hover around the use of Uber and electric vehicle figures, so we looked at a great deal of data and trends to make more accurate assumptions.  It should be noted that we kept this within the United States  Demand is created via businesses buying into the system or a large amount of microtranasactions accounting for a large impact.  Our supply is solely created via electric vehicle drivers.  Outside of these two main components, we weighted other large businesses such as Amazon and Whole Foods buying into our concept and how the market would fluctuate accordingly.  A major challenge that we would like to continue to explore is around the concept of "retiring" the coins.  We simplified this market drastically allowing for coins to immediately retire, but we do worry that some of the value we are exploring could be lost.  In the end, our main goal was to incent beneficial actions that impact all of society.  Our test market allows room for both to occur.  As a result, our prototypes illustrates a real-time recoin market that adjusts based on actions in the market.  We also included a 10 year static market to better exemplify how the market might look over time with a few large impact changes. Size of markets and rate of adoption is based on secondary research.
content.desc: Real-time and 10 year static cryptocurrency market simulation
features: The prototype simulate what it would be like to exchange crypto tokens as they increase in value based on supply and demand. It gives a feel of the market to identify if people would care about intangible assets registered on a distributed code database and take action to participate in the market. In the end the value of the assets solely depends on how many people opt in and believe in the market. We thought about it as a long term ICO, what happens when big companies participate to these token sales? What would it take to increase the value and make this an interesting opportunity to decrease the purchase price of electric vehicles? Questions that remain unanswered are if tokens should be retired as users offset their miles or if they can reuse or trade them more like a currency. This sort of behaviors would be possible if corporations decide to opt in and create more demand for it or start accepting as a currency for certain exchanges.
insights: Financial businesses would find the prototype appealing for exploring the ways that they can think of cryptocurrency and cracking the puzzle of finding intrinsic value.  From an environmental perspective, this could aid all industries and businesses promote their good standing with their employees and communities.  The automotive members could find this very appealing in the way that they are thinking about incentives for the customer base from large fleet purchasing perspectives, as well as, single buyers.  Overall, large discussions should be held around regulation implications.  For example, how removing subsidies can have an effect on buying trends or how imposed subsidies can alter buying psychology.
content.next: The prototype simulate what it would be like to exchange crypto tokens as they increase in value based on supply and demand. It gives a feel of the market to identify if people would care about intangible assets registered on a distributed code database and take action to participate in the market. In the end the value of the assets solely depends on how many people opt in and believe in the market. We thought about it as a long term ICO, what happens when big companies participate to these token sales? What would it take to increase the value and make this an interesting opportunity to decrease the purchase price of electric vehicles? Questions that remain unanswered are if tokens should be retired as users offset their miles or if they can reuse or trade them more like a currency. This sort of behaviors would be possible if corporations decide to opt in and create more demand for it or start accepting as a currency for certain exchanges.
content.why: Simulating markets is an undeniable asset across multiple industries.  What makes ours so compelling is that there is very little that exists today in terms of simulation for cryptocurrency.  In addition, we are trying to express on a surface level how a created market can impact users and incent them in a way that would create social change and hopefully put forth a large impact.

card.desc: Using AR to guide personnel to equipment and/or a patient in a Code Blue scenario.
card.thumbAlt: Another picture of someone wearing a hololens

content.body: A key point in our findings was being able to provide direction for necessary equipment in a timely fashion, when seconds can be life-saving. Our prototype maps out a potential ER area. The scenario is a nurse calls a Code Blue, AI sends messaging to 4 personnel, 2 are sent directions to equipment that is needed, and then directs them to the patient's room. AR identifies the best path, and shows the equipment thru the walls.
content.desc: Using AR to guide personnel to equipment and/or a patient in a Code Blue scenario.
features: AR (HoloLens) combines the power of the augmented capabilities with Neural Networks to find things people want or need.
insights: The objects could be life-saving (reduce Workers Comp impacts), or simply a map to the correct tool, or the closest working one (Energy).  Mapping could be used to teach a process, or show next steps (Any industry). AR could be an onboarding tool that shows a new person around, and provides contextual information based on their role (Any industry). Customers trying to find the closest office, or provider or ER (Blue Cross Blue Shield, could be linked to an online AR experience to provide them with context to their location in relation to the place.

card.desc: Glasscred is an alternative solution to credit score. Use Glasscred with landlords, potential employers, and loan organizations. Build transparent credibility in just 10 minutes.

content.body:
The target market for this prototype is 18-29 year old millennials. Either in college or recently graduated, the financial system as it exists today is stacked against them (and for the most part they have not learned how to play a part in it). A FICO credit score is a system based on EXISTING credit/history, and a majority of this market have not yet built this up (let alone understand what goes into it). This target may not be able to rent a desirable apartment or obtain a loan to buy a car on their current credit history. There are countless data sources  -- from financial data such as bank statements, Vemno/Paypal, Crypto Wallets to Resumes, Academic transcripts, Employer references, prior landlord referrals, and personal references -- that can demonstrate credibility for someone in this demographic.  Glasscred is an alternative solution to credit score that can be used with landlords, potential employers, and loan organizations.  Glasscred combines payment history with important documents to demonstrate an individual’s credibility. A diverse set of inputs help form a comprehensive profile of users’ spending patterns and income sources. On the backend, Glasscred requests access to users’ different accounts and uses this information to construct a user profile. We use the combined power of multiple accounts to establish credibility.

A user’s willingness to add/share their data (# of data sources added), their repayment potential (recurring charges extracted from transaction data) and seasoned funds ($$ in bank) all contribute to their overall Glasscred score.
features: We developed Credibot, a conversational bot that uses NLP/AI to interact with users and answer questions about Glasscred. We’ve started to explore how to incorporate machine learning and blockchain. In the next iteration, we would like to develop a supervised learning algorithm to automate the classification process of user transaction data. In the next iteration, we’d also like to explore how we can take the data which we currently aggregate when when constructing our Glasscred score and register a user’s identity on the blockchain.
insights: We have focused on the use case of a student looking to rent an apartment who has low/no credit score but wants to show they are credible to a potential landlord. The specificity of this use case provided context so we could build Glasscred as an alternative solution to credit score.

Glasscred is valuable to anyone who wants to better understand how their “credibility” is determined and how they can demonstrate and build their credibility. Once we get more input sources of user data, we could do a risk assessment of their spending behavior which could be valuable to a company like Fidelity. In the same way that companies aggregate Fitbit/wearable data, we could leverage/analyze spending behavior (e.g. gym visits, food spending, etc.) to do health insurance pricing on a per-user basis.
links: To better understand the problem space and validate our proposed solution, we solicited data from borrowers/lenders via surveys and in-person interviews. Borrower survey can be found here: https://aspire418.typeform.com/to/DlcXjV.
Lender survey can be found here: https://aspire418.typeform.com/to/Puy0Gc.
content.next:
In the next Sprint, we plan to go deeper into the technical components of the project (i.e. automating classification of user transaction data, develop functionality for Credibot, our conversational AI bot). Our current Glasscred concept is targeted towards students and recent graduates, because they disproportionately comprise the demographic of citizens who have low/no credit score. 
We developed Credibot, a conversational bot that uses NLP/AI to interact with users and answer questions about Glasscred. We’ve started to explore how to incorporate machine learning and blockchain. In the next iteration, we would like to develop a supervised learning algorithm to automate the classification process of user transaction data. In the next iteration, we’d also like to explore how we can take the data which we currently aggregate when when constructing our Glasscred score and register a user’s identity on the blockchain.
content.why: ⅔ of US Citizens ages 18-29 have never obtained a credit score or are credit invisible. We are an alternative solution to credit score. Individuals can use Glasscred with landlords, potential employers, and loan organizations. By helping individuals demonstrate and build transparent credibility, we are helping millennials realize their credibility and simultaneously encouraging them to be more financially responsible.

-Kp0LhMdI6i5Qr_GdlPl.subtitle: An alternative solution to credit scores for landlords, potential employers, and loan organizations.

card.desc: Fonzie creates an automated & authoritative history of vehicle events; creating a platform for transparency, integration, and choice.

content.body:
This prototype builds on the concept of a decentralized vehicle history report. We believe in accessible, verified, real-time information that records and empowers the vehicle to act. Vehicle reporting, under this model, will be decentralized for major events leading to authenticity and real-time decisions making.
 
In this prototype, we attach an accelerometer and shock sensor to a model car. We simulate the scenario of a major car event, such as a crash or excessive speed/breaking. The sensors will throw an error when excessive motion or shock is detected, logging the event onto the blockchain, and potentially alerting a series of automated responses. The users will then be able to see the damage done to each part (sensor) of the car with the vehicle value taking an immediate hit.
content.desc: Fonzie creates an automated & authoritative history of vehicle events; creating a platform for transparency, integration, and choice.
features: The prototype vehicle records sudden vehicle events and can display the event’s impact on (such as price reduction) automatically. Using IoT concepts the vehicle is a logical cluster of sensors that log its history. This history of part events is logged to a blockchain, creating a secure audit trail that cannot be tampered with. Since all issues are on the blockchain, a vehicle history is available that is decentralized and immutable. This removes the reliance on 3rd parties for verification and trust. Because the car failures are decentralized and public, services can be built on this information such as real-time cost analysis, immediate appraisals, or increased safety for 3rd parties.
insights: The blockchain-based real-time vehicle history will significantly reduce the need for verification of vehicle status and maintenance. This immutable history can be used to ensure vehicles are operating at acceptable levels and rectify when they are not. Externally, this opens potential for events-based vehicle histories that could be used in car buying, real-time car value adjustments, immediate collision appraisal, part security, government inspection, or distributed fleet management (ie. Uber could ensure real-time vehicle standards).
content.next: The prototype vehicle records sudden vehicle events and can display the event’s impact on (such as price reduction) automatically. Using IoT concepts the vehicle is a logical cluster of sensors that log its history. This history of part events is logged to a blockchain, creating a secure audit trail that cannot be tampered with. Since all issues are on the blockchain, a vehicle history is available that is decentralized and immutable. This removes the reliance on 3rd parties for verification and trust. Because the car failures are decentralized and public, services can be built on this information such as real-time cost analysis, immediate appraisals, or increased safety for 3rd parties.
content.why: Cars should be able to transparently track their history in an immutable way without third-party verification. The creation and dissemination of an accurate and thorough report relies on the real-time intelligence of the parts of the car. When this information is recorded thoroughly and supplemented with additional data (fleet information, insurance info, security, mechanics, etc), our ability to create and surface automated decisions will create bold new opportunities (history reports, automated appraisals, real-time inspections).

-Kp0P33mv0Lo-Al97ma7.subtitle: An automated history of vehicle events for transparency, integration, and choice.

card.desc: We created an algorithm to verify a particular IoT device's data as well as a market place to sell such data.

content.body: Using standard deviation and statistics principles, our code implemented a ‘trust score’ algorithm to determine a rating for our trustworthy a specific device’s readings were.  The algorithm incorporated mean, variance, z-score, and standard deviation to output this trust score.  We showed a live stream of readings along with their trust score and calculated amount for payout to prove that validating a device’s data in real-time could be done instantly as well as test our hypothesis that we could measure trustworthiness based on precision in real time. Using this truth score concept we also created a user interface and market place app that allow users to sell their device's data to prospective companies.
features: Using standard deviation and statistics principles, our code implemented a ‘trust score’ algorithm to determine a rating for our trustworthy a specific device’s readings were.  The algorithm incorporated mean, variance, z-score, and standard deviation to output this trust score.
insights: For insurance companies, being able to look at individual members in comparison a network of members outliers or extremes can be more easily identified. Our concept of a trust score could be used to better fulfill claims and verify the accuracy of those claims.
content.next: Using standard deviation and statistics principles, our code implemented a ‘trust score’ algorithm to determine a rating for our trustworthy a specific device’s readings were.  The algorithm incorporated mean, variance, z-score, and standard deviation to output this trust score.
content.why: Through our later research we found that this methodology  for verifying data is already being used by such companies as GE for their industrial IOT network. Applying this to consumer IOT we believe could help further enhance validity and verification of data.

card.desc: A network of IoT devices that check each others' location to establish trust

content.body:
Alibi verifies the location and validity of IoT devices to create trustworthy and tradeable data. Devices verify each other through two-way Bluetooth handshakes. These interactions are logged on a blockchain to create a permanent record of trusted devices.

1. Each device broadcasts location and metadata, as well as other devices within range over Bluetooth.

2. When two devices come in range of each other, a handshake is initiated via Bluetooth to exchange hashes.

3. These interactions are logged on a blockchain and sent to a server which checks their validity.

4. This system allows data marketplaces to trust location-sensitive data from any IoT device.
content.desc: A network of IoT devices that check each others' location to establish trust
features: IoT - The increasing ubiquity of IoT devices means that things can talk to each other to establish trust, rather than relying on some central verification service. Bluetooth is already part of many devices and could be easily repurposed as a local system of checks and balances to make data trustworthy.
Blockchain - The record of a device's trustworthiness can be made permanent and decentralized using blockchain. That means that there is no gatekeeper for authenticity.
insights: Members would be able to trust the data they need from IoT devices to make decisions and transactions.
content.next:
IoT - The increasing ubiquity of IoT devices means that things can talk to each other to establish trust, rather than relying on some central verification service. Bluetooth is already part of many devices and could be easily repurposed as a local system of checks and balances to make data trustworthy.

Blockchain - The record of a device's trustworthiness can be made permanent and decentralized using blockchain. That means that there is no gatekeeper for authenticity.
content.why: Alibi establishes trust in IoT devices when location data is crucial to decisions and transactions.

content.body: One reason cities (well Boston at least) aren't collecting data on noise pollution, air quality, foot traffic, etc. even though they care about these data streams, is "time and money." In other words, it is very intensive for city personnel to go around a city installing sensors. This sprint, we were investigating ways to take the pressure of installing these sensors off of the city and instead placing it into the hands of people. To address this challenge, we created Vida, an all inclusive sensor module that contains a camera used for security, monitoring foot and vehicle traffic, and monitoring the availability of street parking, an air quality sensor, and a noise sensor. The idea is we would market this module to the consumer as a security device to keep your home safe, but the consumer can opt-in to share the data gathered by his/her Vida with the city. In return, the city provides access to the aggregate data from multiple Vidas, overlayed over a real time "digital-twin" of the city. Maybe the city also provides a tax break or something. What you end up with is a satisfied consumer with a safer home, and a more efficient city with real-time aggregate data.
content.next: One could expand this sensor to include tracking energy usage/water usage for residencies. Then a power company could use the information to more appropriately distribute energy across the grid during the day.
content.why: Vida makes the process of digitizing a city much easier and less logistically intensive. This is a very implementation heavy solution and is very feasible.

-Kp1SA0vctWQkvCr1yG_.subtitle: An all inclusive sensor module that monitors air quality, noise pollution, street parking, foot traffic and vehicle traffic.
-Kp1SA0vctWQkvCr1yG_.title: Vida

card.desc: Botler automatically buys your favorite snack by knowing your preferences and purchasing history ahead of time.

content.body: Botler can scale to negotiate multiple preference profiles to coordinate group decision-making (a.k.a catering a snack break at a work meeting). With added functionality, Botler could leverage application data about your purchasing habits from apps like Mint, Paypal, or your Bank's native interface, learning what you like, when you like it, and how much you are willing to pay. Ultimately, Botler could learn more about your exact preferences by asking a few simple questions when you set it up, and checking in with you about how you liked your snack when received.
features: Botler takes all of the user inputs to balance the needs of the entire group. It optimizes the results to make sure that no one is stuck with an option that they absolutely can not have. As it gathers more data, it should become smarter to make more accurate, calculated decisions regarding group needs and desires.
Scrapes historical purchasing data through app integrations, but holds them in a secure setting
Syncs with sensors delivering environmental, weather, location data to help inform your choice
Helps solve for choice fatigue by delegating your authority to a bot who knows what you like
Only spend up to a preset amount of money you store in a separate account for its use (like escrow)
Accepst cryptocurrency and live-exchanges into fiat currency as per your location and what the store accepts (AND/OR just uses cryptocurrency with stores that do accept it already)
Can scale to work with other botlers to coordinate group decision-making (a.k.a catering a snack break at a work meeting)
insights: We’re trying to answer the question how comfortable are people to interact, share sensitive information and ultimately relinquish agency to a bot to make their personal decisions (financial included) for them. If we can learn what characteristics of bots could help create that level of trust, we can dramatically lessen the amount of friction for various companies’ automation efforts.

Some further considerations include: Ease of Use to Maintain Trust in Botler, Accuracy of information, Security, Encryption Acting as a gateway between people and organizations, other bots, stores etc., and undesrtanding whether it should it be for a family, small/group, or an individual
content.next: Botler takes all of the user inputs to balance the needs of the entire group. It optimizes the results to make sure that no one is stuck with an option that they absolutely can not have. As it gathers more data, it should become smarter to make more accurate, calculated decisions regarding group needs and desires.
content.why: Botler Bot serves as an example of how individuals can easily express preferences and parameters for a desired purchase on their behalf. This prototype is the first step to understand human behavior when they interact with bots. The knowledge gained from this prototype can be considered when ultimately designing a bot that will have agency to make purchasing decisions on behalf of a person.

-Kp1YBKLrcnakPv1y2aP.subtitle: Automatically buys your favorite snack by knowing your preferences and purchasing history.
team: Dana Martens, Suzan Brandt, Richard Hyun, Noa Kaplan

card.desc: Prop.chain is a platform powered by blockchain technology that enables multiple users to submit critical information about a housing property.

content.body: The process of buying a home for the first time can be daunting. Often, first-time home buyers do not know where to go to retrieve the critical information about a home (e.g., past inspections, recent renovations, permits) and may make uninformed decisions when buying a property. Prop.chain brings transparency to the history of a property using blockchain. Through the prop.chain platform, verified parties can submit critical information about a property. For example, title companies can submit the titles to the property, contractors can submit the work they have completed on a property, and inspectors can submit the results of inspections on properties. As a result, homeowners are able to have a digital history of the property should they want to make future changes to their home and homebuyers are able to access all of the information they need when searching for a property.
features: Our prototype uses blockchain to keep a record of ownership and transactions on a property in a decentralized way so there is transparency into the history of a property.
insights: Our prototype offers insight into how physical possessions can be tracked using blockchain by multiple verified parties.
content.next: Our prototype uses blockchain to keep a record of ownership and transactions on a property in a decentralized way so there is transparency into the history of a property.
content.why: Prop.chain creates a decentralized network to bring transparency to the real estate industry.

card.desc: Momentum is a micro stock market for songs—a decentralized marketplace for musicians and listeners to sell, purchase, and re-sell "shares" of songs through micropayments.

content.body: Momentum provides smart contract-enabled automatic distribution of earnings as shares of songs are bought, sold, and resold. All transactions and records of music play will be recorded in the blockchain automatically. Smart-contract-enabled songs automatically put money in the pockets of the artists who deserve it every time a song share is sold, without middle men or fear of theft. A share is defined as a purchasable license of ownership of one instance of a song/album that is matched to a specific human identity, with unlimited # of plays by the owner. A share can be purchased from the artist in the marketplace, played, and then resold at market rates to others interested in owning a share. Share pricing structures can be codified into smart contracts, allowing for desirable pricing flexibility for both new artists and established stars. New artists can provide for low/no-cost sharing upon release of a new song to incentivize sharing and building up of a follower base, with specific increase in pricing as popularity rises. Big stars can create scarcity of ownership to drive up share prices in a “limited edition” small release of shares and/or “limited lifetime” release of shares.
content.desc: Momentum is a micro stock market for songs—a decentralized marketplace for musicians and listeners to sell, purchase, and re-sell "shares" of songs through micropayments.
features: Our prototype leverages the power of smart contracts, and uses them as a wrapper around content.  These smart contracts are executed whenever a share of a piece of content is sold, which means that artists can be paid for their work whenever that smart contract changes hands.  The smart contract also specifies how the artist is paid, who gets royalties, how their pricing structure works -- taking any room for legal haggling out of the equation.
content.next: Our prototype leverages the power of smart contracts, and uses them as a wrapper around content.  These smart contracts are executed whenever a share of a piece of content is sold, which means that artists can be paid for their work whenever that smart contract changes hands.  The smart contract also specifies how the artist is paid, who gets royalties, how their pricing structure works -- taking any room for legal haggling out of the equation.
content.why:
Momentum allows for content creators to be paid for their hard-fought work. It get rids of legal battles for royalties, and it allows starving musicians to be able to recoup the value of their work if they do make it big someday - they dont have to just keep giving it away for free.

The prototype has big implications for organizations that deal with content sharing, or any type of intellectual property that is consumed on a large scale.

card.desc: BikeChain is a decentralized network of bike repair shops that allows these machines to automatically report issues and match them with the closest, cheapest, most optimal solution.

content.body: When sensors on a bike detect an issue, the bike name, specific problem, and location are posted to BikeChain and the details are logged on the blockchain. A distributed network of bike repair shops, who have previously joined the BikeChain network, report their location, services offered, and fees. When a service provider goes online, they agree to be automatically assigned repair jobs if matched. When a bike problem matches with a repair shop, an entry is created on the block chain. After bike maintenance is performed the repair shop confirms the work and the transaction is posted to the blockchain and payment is automatically processed. We believe that using blockchain smart contracts will enable a decentralized network in which multiple parties can service a city-wide, shared utility, such as bike shares. We are also encouraged by the implications that this system has for other use cases, such as autonomous vehicles, industrial machinery, or public transit.
content.desc: BikeChain is a decentralized network of bike repair shops that allows these machines to automatically report issues and match them with the closest, cheapest, most optimal solution.
features: BikeChain uses underlying block chain to build a decentralized network of repair shops, part availability and provides an optimal solution based on cost, availability, and proximity.
insights: This model will have a profound impact on automotive maintenance, repair, and operations.  As we move towards Autonomous Vehicle future, it’s critical that the machine (AV) self-diagnoses and schedules for a repair in order to minimize downtime and thus improve operational efficiency.
Decentralized, trusted, secure operational model is an essential enabler of Automated Self Repair. Similar logic can be extended to Industrial Machines.
content.why: BikeChain reduces inefficiencies inherent in current centralized repair models and removes the necessity for human intervention in the process of finding solution to issues.
